projectPurpose: To provide a foundational decentralized operating system specifically designed to support and run zero-knowledge (ZK) applications on the Aleo network, enabling private and scalable decentralized applications.
mainFeatures: Decentralized operating system for ZK applications
Forms the backbone of the Aleo network
Stores encrypted application state in a publicly verifiable manner

alternatives.name: Ethereum + ZK-Rollups (e.g., Polygon zkEVM, StarkNet, zkSync)
mainFeatures: Supports a wide range of dApps
Leverages ZK-rollups for scalability and privacy

alternatives.name: Zcash
mainFeatures: Pioneered the use of zk-SNARKs for private transactions

alternatives.name: Polygon
mainFeatures: Offers various scaling technologies including ZK-rollups (zkEVM, Zero)
Lower transaction costs and faster speeds compared to Ethereum mainnet

marketPositioning: snarkOS is positioned as a purpose-built decentralized operating system for zero-knowledge applications, forming the core of the Aleo network. It aims to provide a native environment for private and scalable dApps by integrating ZK proofs deeply into its architecture and consensus mechanism. While other platforms utilize ZK technology, snarkOS differentiates itself by offering a vertically integrated ZK-centric layer 1 blockchain specifically designed for this use case, rather than being a scaling solution or a privacy feature built on top of an existing, more general-purpose blockchain.
